docstr: `SINH` — Hyperbolic sine function ### Description `SINH(X)` computes the hyperbolic sine of `X`. ### Syntax `RESULT = SINH(X)` ### Arguments . ### Return value The return value has same type and kind as `X`. ### Example ``` program test_sinh   real(8) :: x = - 1.0_8   x = sinh(x) end program test_sinh ``` ### Specific names | Name | Argument | Return type | Standard | `SINH(X)` | `REAL(4) X` | `REAL(4)` | Fortran 95 and later | `DSINH(X)` | `REAL(8) X` | `REAL(8)` | Fortran 95 and later ### Standard Fortran 95 and later, for a complex argument Fortran 2008 or later ### Class Elemental function ### See also ASINH
